oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1955-08-27 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from August 27, 1955. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Hank Snow (host/performer), guest performer Marty Robbins, and regular performers the Jordanaires, Tommy Vaden, Chubby Wise, Moon Mullican, Rod Brasfield, and Chet Atkins. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Rod Brasfield; Marty Robbins; Chet Atkins; Hank Show
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Hank Snow introduces Rod Brasfield -- Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield, Hank Snow) -- Hank Snow introduces Marty Robbins -- This Broken Heart Of Mine (Marty Robbins) -- Hank Snow introduces Chet Atkins -- Smile (Chet Atkins) -- National Safety Council P.S.A. (Grant Turner) -- Hank Snow talks -- (Now And Then There's) A Fool Such As I (Hank Snow) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Hank Snow) -- Cavalier Cigarettes commercial -- Station announcements
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Snow, Hank; Brasfield, Rod; Atkins, Chet; Mullican, Moon, 1909-1967; Jordanaires (Musical group); Wise, Chubby; Vaden, Tommy; Robbins, Marty
